name: DC Comics - The Atom Quiz | DC Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: Comic book readers were introduced to the character of Ray Palmer (Atom) in 1961. He is a physicist and a professor at what university?
questions.explanation:
Ivy University.

	Ray works at Ivy University in the Ivy City, which is somewhere in New England.

questions.text: Generally portrayed as being 6" in height, the Atom can actually shrink and grow to varying degrees, including subatomic.  What device did Ray Palmer create to originally accomplish this ability?
questions.explanation:
Size Control Belt.

	The Ray Palmer version of the Atom (along with his size control belt!) was created by Garner Fox, Gil Kane and Murphy Anderson.

questions.text: What is the power source that the Atom's personal control device harnesses in order to grant him the ability to alter his size and weight?
questions.explanation:
White dwarf star matter.

	Differing origins have him either turn a piece of the white star matter into a lens, or have him focus a lens made of diamond onto the dwarf star matter.

questions.text: The silver age Atom (Ray Palmer) had a unique way of transporting himself from place to place.  What device did he employ?
questions.explanation:
Telephone.

	Ray would call a phone at the destination he wished to reach, and when they answered he would shrink down and travel through the phone lines!

questions.text: The silver age Atom was given his own title in 1962.  It ran 38 issues until 1968.  With ratings sagging another hero was given co-star status and billing, beginning with issue 39.  Who was it?
questions.explanation:
Hawkman.

	Hawkman's own title (vol.1) was cancelled in 1968.  He was brought over to the Atom's comic book.  'Atom and Hawkman' lasted seven issues, and was cancelled in 1969 with issue #45.

questions.text: When the Atom (Ray Palmer) debuted, he had a long time girlfriend.  Over the years the two would eventually marry.  Subsequently she would go on to have an affair (1983) and the two would divorce.  What is her name?
questions.explanation:
Jean Loring.

	Jean was an attorney, who's relationship with Ray always seemed troubled.  In 2004 Jean would undergo a complete mental breakdown and end up murdering the wife of a Justice League member.  Ray then had her institutionalized.

questions.text: Following his wife's affair, Atom (Ray Palmer) spends most of the 1980s living in Brazil among a group of miniature sized aliens.  What is the title of the mini-series and follow-up specials that depict this period?
questions.explanation:
'Sword of the Atom'.

	Originally trapped at his six-inch height, Atom finds new love and purpose in the mini-series.  Even after his ability to return to normal size is returned, he opts to continue living with the Morlaidh people.  The colony is eventually destroyed.

questions.text: Following the events of 'Zero Hour' (1994/95) Ray finds his body has de-aged to being much younger.  He gains the ability to expand his size as well as decrease it.  What team does he become field leader for?
questions.explanation:
Teen Titans.

	This was a short lived version of the Teen Titans whose members consisted of some teens discovering they were human hybrids.  Atom felt his association with the team was a step down, having been a former member of the Justice League.

questions.text: In 2011, DC rebooted its entire line of comics - referred to as the "New 52".  In this continuity, Ray Palmer still has his abilities, but he works for what organization?
questions.explanation:
S.H.A.D.E.

	Ray is the group's science adviser, and his technology allows the S.H.A.D.E. agents to enter and leave their microscopic sized headquarters. S.H.A.D.E. is the Super-Human Advanced Defense Executive.

questions.text: While Ray Palmer is no doubt the most well known of the individuals who have used that name Atom, he is not the only one.  Which of the following did NOT have a stint at some point as Atom?
questions.explanation:
Ronnie Raymond.

	Al Prat was the original "golden age" Atom, created in 1940. Adam Cray was Atom of the Suicide Squad in the early 1990s, recruited by Ray Palmer while faking his own death. Ryan Choi was a protege of Ray Palmer who served as the Atom from 2006-2011.
